fields.summary: Registering an OSG Registers Other Components Which Can Lead to Services Cruft

fields.description:
Hi All,

Running eucalyptus 4.0.0 with following packages

{code}
eucalyptus-cloud-4.0.0-0.0.734.20140322giteeeb3416.el6.x86_64
{code}

End goal is to have objectstorage on another host then compute. The component placement should look like this box wise

box1: compute/db/euare/tokens/as/cw/elb
box2: riakcs/osg

Installed following packages on box1:

{code}
yum install eucalyptus-cloud
{code}

Then initialize the database and register compute, tokens and euare services. Following was the output of euca-describe-services

{code}
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Dns   	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	euare          	euare          	euare          	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Euare 	arn:euca:bootstrap:euare:euare:euare/
SERVICE	compute        	compute        	compute        	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:compute/
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	tokens         	tokens         	token          	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:bootstrap:tokens:tokens:token/
SERVICE	autoscalingback	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/AutoScalingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::autoscalingbackend:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	cloudwatchbacke	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/CloudWatchBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::cloudwatchbackend:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	loadbalancingba	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	NOTREADY  	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/LoadBalancingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::loadbalancingbackend:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Jetty 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	imaging        	imaging        	10.104.1.211   	NOTREADY  	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Imaging	arn:euca:bootstrap:imaging:imaging:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.1.211/
{code}

Now start with box2 , installed following packages there (note: riakcs will be installed and configured later, right now goal is to have osg registered):

{code}
yum install eucalyptus-common-java eucalyptus-osg
{code}

Then start the eucalyptus-cloud service on the box2

{code}
service eucalyptus-cloud start
{code}

Now on box1 try to register the osg like this:

{code}
euca_conf --register-osg --partition objectstorage --host 10.104.1.212 --component osg
{code}

But it registers all other services as well on box2 , see below:

{code}
Created new partition 'objectstorage'
SERVICE	objectstorage  	objectstorage  	osg            	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/objectstorage	arn:euca:bootstrap:objectstorage:objectstorage:osg/
Registered the first Object Storage Gateway. You must choose a object storage back end client with ``euca-modify-property -p objectstorage.providerclient=$PROVIDER (e.g. walrus or s3)
root@10.104.1.212's password: 
Created new partition 'autoscaling'
SERVICE	autoscaling    	autoscaling    	AS_212         	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:bootstrap:autoscaling:autoscaling:AS_212/
Created new partition 'cloudwatch'
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	cloudwatch     	CW_212         	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:bootstrap:cloudwatch:cloudwatch:CW_212/
SERVICE	compute        	compute        	COM_212        	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_212/
SERVICE	euare          	euare          	EUA_212        	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/Euare 	arn:euca:bootstrap:euare:euare:EUA_212/
Created new partition 'loadbalancing'
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	LB_212         	LOADED    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:LB_212/
SERVICE	tokens         	tokens         	TOK_212        	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:bootstrap:tokens:tokens:TOK_212/
{code}

Ending up with euca-describe-services shown below:

{code}
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Dns   	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	cloudwatch     	CW_212         	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:bootstrap:cloudwatch:cloudwatch:CW_212/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	euare          	euare          	EUA_212        	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/Euare 	arn:euca:bootstrap:euare:euare:EUA_212/
SERVICE	euare          	euare          	euare          	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Euare 	arn:euca:bootstrap:euare:euare:euare/
SERVICE	compute        	compute        	COM_212        	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:COM_212/
SERVICE	compute        	compute        	compute        	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/compute	arn:euca:bootstrap:compute:compute:compute/
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	tokens         	tokens         	TOK_212        	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:bootstrap:tokens:tokens:TOK_212/
SERVICE	tokens         	tokens         	token          	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:bootstrap:tokens:tokens:token/
SERVICE	autoscalingback	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/AutoScalingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::autoscalingbackend:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	autoscaling    	autoscaling    	AS_212         	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:bootstrap:autoscaling:autoscaling:AS_212/
SERVICE	objectstorage  	objectstorage  	osg            	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/objectstorage	arn:euca:bootstrap:objectstorage:objectstorage:osg/
SERVICE	cloudwatchbacke	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/CloudWatchBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::cloudwatchbackend:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	loadbalancingba	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	NOTREADY  	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/LoadBalancingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::loadbalancingbackend:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Jetty 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	imaging        	imaging        	10.104.1.211   	NOTREADY  	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Imaging	arn:euca:bootstrap:imaging:imaging:10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.211   	ENABLED   	23  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.1.211/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	loadbalancing  	LB_212         	BROKEN    	23  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:bootstrap:loadbalancing:loadbalancing:LB_212/
{code}

Question: 

How to register OSG on separate host then compute/DB?

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: registering osg on separate host registers other services automatically

comments.body:
[~dshekhawat], the design of the system *requires* that all user facing services be co-located on each host.  Thus, if you want a new OSG, you'll also need to add the EC2, AS, IAM, LB, etc... services on the same host.

[~decker], please confirm

OK! I used euca-register-user-services against box1 and box2 and now got all services ENABELD. I now  have 2 compute and 2 osg and both are ACTIVE/ACTIVE with riakcs as backend for OSG :)

Now if I deregister compute from box2 it is successful but does it break the design of eucalyptus? Meaning is that a supported configuration anymore? I think I would need [~decker] time to understand how exactly it is suppose to work and what would be un-supported configurations , please can you ? :)
